programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Cheryl asks Jack to father her child, but Jack refuses. Janet thinks Cheryl wants to marry Jack because she's going to have his baby, so she talks Jack into complying with Cheryl's wishes. Guest Star(s): Joanna Kerns

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Larry discovers an answered magazine quiz and he and Jack think one of the girls wants to have an affair with Jack. They take the girls on a weekend trip to find out who answered the quiz so Jack can talk her out of it.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack receives $1,000 by mistake from an automated cash machine. He hides it in the couch for the weekend but when the Bank Security arrives to collect the money, it is nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack writes a nasty letter to a famous food critic, thinking the critic is going to give his bistro a ruinous review. When the critic assures Jack the review will be favorable, Jack tries to retrieve the letter from the critic's desk.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack is dating a sex therapist who has asked him to keep her job a secret. Janet, concluding she is a prostitute, is nasty to her and no one can understand why - especially when Janet's own father has become so friendly with her.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack has two dates, so he talks Larry into posing as him and spending the day with his unwanted date, Janet's childhood friend, who is visiting from out of town.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack believes he has won a baking contest that is open only to women. Disguised as "Grandma Tripper," he goes to collect the check and learns that he is a finalist and must bake his cookies for the company's executives to win the prize.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack's father visits unexpectedly and resumes his good nature meddling. Jack explodes and tells him to stay out of his life, but when he learns his father has lost his job, Jack gives him the opportunity to be useful.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Terri is up for a promotion and tells Dr. Kenderson she is married to ward off his advances. When he invites himself and his wife over for dinner, Jack poses as Terri's husband while Janet and Larry pose as French-speaking house guests.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: When Jack attends a charity ball with a socialite and loses $15,000 gambling, Larry and the girls attempt to help him recover the money.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: The girls flip over a handsome Englishman who moves in next door, but Jack and Furley become convinced that he is one of London's most sought after criminals.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Janet is thrilled with her new job as an aerobics teacher, and her new boss Tina is thrilled with Jack. When Tina blackmails Jack into being at her beck and call, Larry offers to take her off Jack's hands.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack meets an old flame at the park who is seeking advice about her jealous husband. Furley joins them, and they all get poison oak. Later, at Jack's house, Furley tells the husband they were all in the bushes together.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack and Furley get locked in a freezer together. Convinced they are going to die, they have a heart-to-heart talk, and Jack confesses that he really isn't gay. Once safe, Jack worries because Furley knows the truth about him.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: The trio plants a stray cat at Furley's door, hoping he'll bend his rules and keep it. When a girl appears looking for her kitten, Furley lies and says he took it to the pound; so Jack and the girls search the pounds and bring home three different cats.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: After a night on the town with his old navy buddies, Jack discovers he has a tattoo on his derriere. When Jack goes to the hospital to have it removed, Janet thinks he is having a vasectomy and Furley thinks he is having a sex change.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack offers to model for a beautiful art teacher and finds himself nude in front of her classroom when Furley walks in. Jack begs Furley not to tell, but the secret is out when a nude portrait of Jack appears at the Regal Beagle.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack borrows Janet's new car to drive a gorgeous model to a photo session and totals the car on the way home. He pretends to have amnesia in the hospital, but Janet gets suspicious and concocts a plan to help him regain his memory.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: A customer of the flower shop names Janet in his will, and she receives a vase. His nephew, Philip, an art collector, visits Janet, and Jack thinks he lied about the value of the vase and is trying to get it back.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack meets an attractive stewardess, Vicky Bradford; but between her father and her dates, she doesn't seem to have time for Jack. Janet announces her engagement to Philip, while Jack is jealous and lovesick.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack thinks Vicky wants a job in Houston and encourages her, causing her to think he wants to end their relationship. She interrupts Janet's wedding to find out why. They make up and the ceremony resumes. Jack proposes and is stunned by Vicky's refusal.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Vicky explains that she is afraid of marriage and suggests to Jack that they live together. Jack reluctantly agrees. They are toasting their first night together in their new apartment when they are interrupted by Mr. Bradford.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: In order to convince their landlord, Mr. Roper, that there is nothing going on between them and their new male roommate, Chrissy and Janet tell him that Jack is gay.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Chrissy's visiting mother, not knowing that the girls have rented the spare room to Jack, causes havoc when she decides to spend the night with them.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Roper feels convinced that his niece will be safe going out with Jack, and Jack would rather be with Janet and Chrissy celebrating Janet's birthday, until he sees the niece.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack's fast-talking friend, Larry, gives Jack and the girls a puppy and the kids go to all lengths keeping this from Roper who forbids animals in his building.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack has guilt feelings about not standing up to the tough guy who makes a play for Chrissy at the local pub and goes back the next night to tell the Casanova off.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation

programme.title: Tiny House Nation
programme.desc: Lauren and Liam want their already small life to become even smaller by building a nautically inspired tiny house.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation
programme.desc: Sarah and Tabatha ask John and Zack to help them build a rustic tiny house that can withstand all the dirt and grit of farm life.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation
programme.desc: Tommy and Katie are world-class triathletes who ask John and Zack to help create their first home and make it a space that gives them both a cozy place to come back to but can still function as a space to train in between competitions.

programme.title: Floyd Mayweather vs Zab Judah
programme.desc: On April 8th, 2006, Floyd Mayweather fought Zab Judah for the IBF and IBO Welterweight Titles at Thomas & Mack Center in Las Vegas. In a fight with a dramatic melee in round 10, Mayweather cruised in the later rounds to win by unanimous decision.

programme.title: Freddie Roach vs Joe Ruelaz
programme.desc: On August 9th, 1984, Freddie Roach fought Joe Ruelaz in a super featherweight bout in Las Vegas. The more experienced Roach made easy work of Ruelaz, stopping him in the fourth round.

programme.title: Freddie Roach vs Mario Chavez
programme.desc: On May 28th, 1981 Freddie Roach faced Mario Chavez at the Hacienda Hotel in Las Vegas resulting in a unanimous decision win for Roach.

programme.title: Genaro Hernandez vs Azumah Nelson
programme.desc: On March 22nd, 1997, Genaro Hernandez fought Azumah Nelson for the World Super Featherweight Championship at the Memorial Coliseum in Corpus Christi. Hernandez looked like the more confident fighter, earning a close split decision victory.

programme.title: George Foreman vs Adilson Rodrigues
programme.desc: On June 16th, 1990 George Foreman fought Adilson Rodrigues at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas resulting in a victory for Foreman in round two by technical knockout.

programme.title: George Foreman vs Alex Stewart
programme.desc: On April 11th, 1992 George Foreman faced Alex Stewart at the Thomas & Mack Center in Las Vegas ending in a majority decision victory for Foreman.

programme.title: George Foreman vs Gerry Cooney
programme.desc: On January 15th, 1990 George Foreman and Gerry Cooney fought at the Reno-Sparks Convention Center in Reno, Las Vegas ending in a majority decision victory for Foreman.

programme.title: George Kambosos vs Devin Haney 1
programme.desc: On June 5th, 2022 George Kambosos and Devin Haney fought for the first time at Marvel Stadium in Melboure for the IBF, WBA, WBC & WBO World lightweight titles resulting in a victory for Devin Haney.

programme.title: Hector Camacho vs Sugar Ray Leonard
programme.desc: On January 3rd, 1997 Hector Camacho faced Sugar Ray Leonard at the Convention Center in Atlantic City battling for IBC Middleweight title the bout ended after five rounds resulting in a victory for Leonard by technical knockout.

programme.title: Top Rank Classics
programme.desc: On June 18th, 2022 Artur Beterbiev and Joe Smith Jr faced eachother in a battle for IBF, WBC and WBO World Light Heavyweight title at Madison Square Garden that ended by technical knockout in the second round securing the win for Beterbiev.

programme.title: Top Rank Classics
programme.desc: On December 17th, 2021, Artur Beterbiev and Marcus Browne fought at The Bell Centre in Montreal for IBF & WBC World Light Heavyweight titles.

programme.title: Artur Beterbiev vs Oleksandr Gvozdyk
programme.desc: On October 18th, 2019, Artur Beterbiev fought Oleksandr Gvozdyk for the WBC and IBF Light Heavyweight Titles at Liacouras Center in Philadelphia. Beterbiev put on the pressure late, scoring three knockdowns in the 10th round in a TKO victory.

programme.title: Top Rank Classics
programme.desc: On June 9th, 2020, a young Shakur Stevenson fought Felix Caraballo in a super featherweight bout in The Bubble at MGM Grand. After knocking down Caraballo in rounds 1 and 6, Stevenson would get the KO with a devastating body shot in round six.

programme.title: Top Rank Classics
programme.desc: On April 20th, 2019, Shakur Stevenson fought Chris Diaz for the IBF and WBO NABO Featherweight Titles at Madison Square Garden in New York. Stevenson outclassed Diaz with his class and precision earning a unanimous decision victory.

programme.title: Top Rank Classics
programme.desc: On October 31st, 2020 Naoya Inoue faced Jason Moloney in The Bubble at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas for the IBF and WBA World Super Bantamweight titles ending in a knockout in the 7th round by Inoue.

programme.title: Aaron Pryor vs Alexis Arguello
programme.desc: On November 12th, 1982, Aaron Pryor fought Alexis Arguello for the WBA World Light Welterweight Title at the Orange Bowl in Miami. Despite Arguello being the favorite, Pryor stopped Arguello in the 14th round in The Ring's Fight of the Decade.

programme.title: Tyson Fury vs Otto Wallin
programme.desc: On September 14th, 2019, Tyson Fury fought Otto Wallin for the Lineal Heavyweight Championship at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas. Despite sustaining a severe cut above his eye early on, Fury prevailed and emerged victorious with an unanimous decision.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Dark Side of Dimensions
programme.desc: The stakes have never been higher, the rivalries never as fierce, the risks never so great. One wrong move - one card short - and it's game over for good.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi is forced to face Duel Monsters creator, Maximillion Pegasus, in the mysterious Shadow Realm where all the monsters and magic are real. If Yugi loses, Pegasus claims Grandpa's soul as his prize!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi gives up one of his own Star Chips so Joey can board the boat bound for Duelist Kingdom and duel to save his sister's eyesight. Meanwhile, the cheat Weevil tries to cripple Yugi's deck by tossing his best cards overboard!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus announces that there are many strange secrets that will make his ultimate tournament unlike any they've ever had. Yugi must not only figure the rules out, but master them if he's to survive!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After Yugi defeats Weevil's first wave of Duel Monsters, he's shocked to discover that Weevil has one last trick up his sleeve; a ravenous Great Moth that grows in power with every turn!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey finds himself courageously accepting a challenge from veteran duelist, Mai. But when Mai begins to demonstrate an unnerving psychic ability, Joey has to figure out Mai's secret strategy before falling victim to it!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The fisherman duelist baits Yugi into a duel on his own sea playing field for a home-field advantage. Can Yugi adapt to these new settings to turn the tide of battle?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: If Yugi is eliminated from the tournament, KaibaCorp's crooked Board of Directors will transfer control of the company from Kaiba to Pegasus! Kaiba's brother Mokuba challenges Yugi to a duel to protect his brother's company!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi must duel a magical doppelganger of Kaiba, created from the greed and power lust Yugi wiped from Kaiba's soul.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi defeats the Blue Eyes White Dragon, but there are two more waiting in the wings! Will the real Kaiba reach Yugi in time to help beat this impersonator?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey decides to battle Rex Raptor without his friends' help to prove that he is man enough to take care of Serenity on his own.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey duels valiantly, but Rex Raptor has unleashed his secret weapon: the Red-Eyes Black Dragon!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi's classmate Bakura, possessed by his Millennium Ring's dark powers, traps Yugi and friends in a Shadow Game where they become the cards themselves!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus's hired duelist Panik cheats Mai of all her star chips, and Yugi vows to defeat him and win them back. But when Panik's Castle of Dark Illusions enshrouds his monsters in a black mist, how can Yugi defeat an enemy he cannot see?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Despite his astonishing disadvantage, Yugi boldly provokes Panik - "I'll finish you in three turns." Is Yugi bluffing, or does he have the advantage in this battle of wits?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba descends to the kingdom to face Pegasus. Has Kaiba changed since his battle with Yugi, or is he still the same merciless duelist? A battle between Kaiba's Blue Eyes White Dragon and Joey's Red Eyes Black Dragon holds the answers!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Bandit Keith's gang kidnaps Joey to a secret cave with a graveyard playing field. As Yugi and friends search for him, Joey faces Bandit Keith's zombie monsters which become stronger as they return from the grave!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey's last-ditch effort, his lucky Time Wizard card, fails against Bandit Keith's zombie monsters. But as his lucky streak comes to an end, will his improving skills as a duelist and his love for his sister inspire him to victory?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!

programme.desc: Cat's favorite actress dies and she talks Tori and Jade into driving to the actress' house to hold a vigil. Meanwhile, Trina directs a play starring herself, with Beck, Andre, and Robbie.

programme.title: Victorious: Tori & Jade's Play Date
programme.desc: Tori and Jade play a married couple putting their acting abilities and uneasy friendship to the test. Meanwhile, Cat & Robbie start a service where they deliver bad news in a friendly way.

programme.title: Victorious: The Gorilla Club
programme.desc: In an effort to take more risks as an actress, Tori goes to an underground spot called "The Gorilla Club." Meanwhile, Andre and Robbie lose a very interesting bet to Jade.

programme.title: Victorious: Driving Tori Crazy
programme.desc: When a movie shoot causes a traffic jam and interferes with Tori's morning commute, she turns to her friends for help. Meanwhile, Cat becomes addicted to an email coupon service.

programme.title: Victorious: How Trina Got In
programme.desc: Andre, Jade, Cat, and Beck trade urban legends about how Trina got accepted into Hollywood Arts. Meanwhile, Tori and Robbie are stuck at Nozu unable to pay their bill.

programme.title: Victorious: Crazy Ponnie
programme.desc: A strange new student named Ponnie befriends Tori but keeps disappearing around other people. Everyone worries Tori might be losing it, but Tori suspects that something more sinister is afoot.

programme.title: Victorious: Wanko's Warehouse
programme.desc: The gang's favorite megastore is having a massive sale. In order to avoid a huge line of customers, the kids hide out in the store until it closes so they can grab what they want before it's gone.

programme.title: Victorious: The Blonde Squad
programme.desc: While wearing a blonde wig and blue contacts for a film, Cat meets a boy and they quickly hit it off. When Cat realizes he thinks her costume is real, she worries he won't like the real her.

programme.title: Victorious: The Hambone King
programme.desc: After posting a hamboning (rhythmic thigh and knee-slapping) video online, Robbie is challenged for the title of Hambone King. When Robbie is beaten, Tori agrees to help Robbie avenge his defeat.

programme.title: Victorious: Tori Goes Platinum Pt. 1
programme.desc: Tori gets an opportunity to perform a song at a big awards program, but she's pushed into altering everything about herself in the process.

programme.title: Victorious: Tori Goes Platinum Pt. 2
programme.desc: Tori gets to sing at a big music awards show, but the producer wants to totally change her look and behavior. Tori agrees, but finds that she doesn't like her new image.

programme.title: Victorious: Opposite Date
programme.desc: After a group activity falls apart Tori and Beck decide to go on an "Opposite Date" where they do things that people would never do on a REAL date.

programme.title: Victorious: Cell Block
programme.desc: Sikowitz challenges the kids to go a week without using their phones, laptops, or other portable electronic devices. The kids accept and quickly realize it's not going to be as easy as they thought.

programme.title: Victorious: Three Girls And A Moose
programme.desc: Tori, Cat, and Jade compete with each other to win the affection of Beck's big, handsome, hockey-loving Canadian friend, Moose.

programme.title: iCarly
programme.desc: iAm Your Biggest Fan: iCarly's biggest fan, Mandy, is invited onto the show as a one-girl studio audience. Mandy turns out to be more of a stalker than a fan and the kids have to get rid of her.

programme.title: iCarly
programme.desc: iSaw Him First: When Carly and Sam show interest in the same boy, they vow to not let him come between them.

programme.title: iCarly
programme.desc: Carly needs to intervene when Spencer becomes addicted to playing a video game.

programme.title: iCarly
programme.desc: iOwe You: Sam is insulted when Freddie accuses her of not paying him and Carly back any of the money she's constantly borrowing.

programme.title: iCarly
programme.desc: iHurt Lewbert: A "Messing With Lewbert" sketch goes horribly awry, injuring Carly's obnoxious doorman.

programme.title: iCarly
programme.desc: iPie: When Carly, Sam, and Spencer bring Freddie to their favorite pie shop, they learn that its proprietor has passed away. Worse more, it appears that his recipes may be lost forever.
